meanings.definition: The text of an opera or other long vocal work.
meanings.sent1: The librettos for the opera were beautifully written and brought the story to life.
meanings.sent2: She studied the librettos carefully before the performance.
meanings.sent3: The librettos for the musical were so funny that the audience couldn't stop laughing.
meanings.sent4: His words danced on the librettos, creating a symphony of emotions.
meanings.sent5: The vivid imagery in the librettos painted a picture of love and tragedy.

meanings.sent1: The singers each held their librettos as they prepared to go on stage.
meanings.sent2: The librettos contained the lyrics for the entire performance.
meanings.sent3: The stack of librettos on the table looked like a mountain of music.
meanings.sent4: The librettos fluttered like colorful butterflies in the hands of the performers.
meanings.sent5: The librettos whispered the secrets of the characters to the audience.
